newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah lower in thin late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah lower in thin late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was lower against the dollar in late trading on Friday, dealers said.
"The market is almost dead," one local bank dealer said, adding that many players had left for long weekend.
He said some late short-covering in dollars seemed to cause a small decline of the rupiah. Spot rupiah was last taken at 2,378.25 at 0800 GMT, against an opening of 2,377.0/78.0.
Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,377.5/78.00 and 2,371.75/72.50, respectively.
Dealers said liquidity eased in the afternoon, with overnight money falling to 13.0 percent from 15.0/16.0 percent.
The central bank offered five-day bilateral papers (SBIs) at eight percent, two-week at 10.0 percent, one and three-month at 11.25 and 12.0 percent.
Overnight swaps were at 4.0/4.5 and tom/next at 0.7/0.8.
The foreign exchange market will be closed for Eid al-Fitr on February 10 and 11 and reopen on February 12, while the stock market will be closed from February 7 to 11 inclusive.
One-month swaps were at 14.25/15.00, two at 29.0/30.5, three at 39.5/40.5 and six at 78.00/80.00 points.
The central bank raised its intervention band by one point to 2,376/2,568 and the conversion band to 2,376/2,424 on Friday, the fourth depreciation this week.
The bank depreciated the rupiah by three points last week after lowering it by two points the previous week.
